Title: First LNG tanker to cross the Red Sea and the Suez Canal since mid-January
Description: An LNG carrier is headed to the Red Sea and further to the Mediterranean Sea via the Suez Canal in the first such transit since mid-January as the escalation of attacks on commercial vessels by the Houthi militants pushed shippers to steer clear of the shipping route.
Author: JS

Title: Var Energi, VNG extend gas sales agreement for 12 years
Description: Norway’s energy company Var Energi has extended its gas sales agreement with Germany’s VNG for the delivery of up to 5 billion m3 per year of natural gas for another 12 years.
Author: JS

Title: Perenco buys 10% stake in Golar LNG
Description: Independent Anglo-French oil and gas company Perenco has bought a picked up an approximately 10% stake in Bermuda-headquartered LNG infrastructure player Golar LNG, according to a filing.
Author: JS

Title: Shell signs deal to acquire Pavilion Energy, bolstering its LNG market position
Description: Shell has signed a deal to acquire Singapore-based energy firm Pavilion Energy. The move aims to bolster Shell's leading position in the LNG market by giving it access to a global LNG trading business with a contracted supply of about 6.5 mtpa, as well as shipping, gas supply, and marketing activities in Asia and Europe.
Author: CK

Title: Deutsche Ostsee terminal in Mukran to start full operations on Jul. 1 after second FSRU’s arrival
Description: German terminal operator Deutsche ReGas is targeting the start of full operations of the second phase of its Deutsche Ostsee LNG terminal in Mukran on July 1, taking into account the arrival of its second floating storage regasification, the 145,130 m3 Neptune.
Author: CK
